statement.tex: Find the equation of the tangent and normal to the curve \[ \qquad x = a\sin^3\theta \text{ and } y = a\cos^3\theta \] at $\theta = \dfrac\pi{4}$

options.tex: %text The tangent and normal will pass through the point $A = \pta$%

reason.tex: %text What we have here is a parametric curve in which both $x$ and $y$ are defined in terms of a third parameter $\theta$ And for $\theta = \frac{\pi}{4}$, the point $A$ on the curve is given by \[ A = \left(a\sin^3 \frac{\pi}{4}, a\cos^3 \frac{\pi}{4} \right) = \pta \] %

options.tex:
%text If $m_T$ be the slope of the tangent and $m_N$ the slope of the normal at $A$, then % \begin{align} \begin{tabular}{NNN}
\hline & \text{Expression} & \text{Value} \\ \hline m_T & \frac{dy}{dx} & 1 \\ \hline m_N & & -1 \\ \hline \end{tabular} \end{align} %text %
